course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Popular Religion in South China
course.description: This course adopts an anthropological approach to the study of popular religion in South China. The relationships among popular religion and other socio-cultural institutions and the interactions between local societies and the state will be  explored. The structure of temples, the processes of festivals and pilgrimages, meanings of religious activities, and concepts of the religious values and system will be examined.

reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
Quiz I 250 points
Quiz II 250 point
Research paper statement 30 points
Research paper 270 points
Tutorial sessions 200
Total 1000 points
=========
Bonus Points
Optional fieldtrip report +15 points
Lecture attendance +25 points
Project presentation +15 points
Absence from a tutorial ‐ 20 points


Lecture attendance: Students’ lecture attendance will be checked randomly for 6 times. Five bonus points will be given to the students who attend a lecture. A student can earn a maximum of 25 points.

Fieldtrips: 4‐6 hours each, will be arranged during the semester. not compulsory, a student can earn at most 15 bonus points by attending a fieldtrip and submitting a fieldtrip report in two weeks after the fieldtrip. The fieldtrip report must be typed and not longer than 3 pages. Each student can participate in more than one fieldtrip, but can only earn not more than 15 bonus points.
reviews.comment_workload:
Tutorial session:
Students will be evaluated according to their presentations and participation in tutorial discussions. Students will receive no points for attending any tutorials. However, 20 points will be taken away from the total tutorial score if a student is absent from a tutorial.

Two quizzes:
Quiz questions are based on materials drawn from lectures, tutorials, films, and assigned readings. The materials covered in the first quiz, will not be included in the second one.

Research project:
Students are required to complete a field research project. This means that you must collect your research data by talking to people and observing people’s activities. Don’t collect your primary data from the web.
If the research project is conducted by one student, the text of the paper should have at least 3000 words. If the research is conducted by two students, 4000 words are expected. Please keep photos, graphics, or any field materials as appendices at the back of the paper.

reviews.title: 一個好心地但好鬼癲既professor
reviews.comment_content:
廖廸生係科大人類學研究既開山鼻祖，基本上冇佢都唔會開到GCS(同埋有個咩華南研究所)。通常我地都係叫佢做廖生。講到明民間宗教，一定唔係講果d主流宗教，針對講既會係天后，宗族，祖先同埋生死儀式。因為廖生既專長係研究天后，所以上堂多數時間都會講番天后既野。
基本上內容如下：
Ch.1 Introduction，講下宗教同社會既關係
Ch.2 點做Fieldwork
Ch.3 人類學基本認識，講下佢專長既文化人類學
Ch.4 文化可以點分析，有邊幾個範疇
Ch.5 Project (有Paper要寫架)
Ch.6 咩係宗教，咩係民間宗教
Ch.7 神仙體系，原始宗教
Ch.8 廟入邊既結構既含義
Ch.9 香港聯鄉廟宇
Ch.10 做大戲如何體會中國人既生死觀，劇伶係傳統社會既地位
Ch.11 朝聖，特別係講台灣果邊既媽祖崇拜
Ch.12 對生死既傳統觀念
Ch.13 儀式既種類同意義
Ch.14 祖先崇拜
